Reviews.Title: A remarkably competent long-zoom camera that costs very little
Reviews.Author: conradb212
Reviews.Content: It's absolutely remarkable how far digital cameras have come. And how much camera you can get for the money these days. And that's precisely the problem camera makers face today: it's hard to make a profit as prices drop ever lower. And, adding insult to injury, almost all of today's smartphones already have increasingly competent high res still/video cameras built in.That's why we're seeing the traditional camera makers get into specialties and niches that the smartphone cameras can't touch (yet). Things like tough cameras that can go underwater, or, as is the case with the SZ-12 from Olympus, a very long optical zoom. Most inexpensive cameras have 3X to 5X optical zooms. The SZ-12 has 24X. That means you can get really close to far-away objects, and unlike digital zoom that multiplies the reach of most digital cameras, optical zoom results in much better and sharper pictures. And the SZ-12's rather sophisticated image stabilization works remarkably well.The SZ-12 has other nice features, like a bright and sharp 3-inch LCD display and it can take not only those high-res 14-megapixel pictures, but also very respectable 720p HD video. That's not quite the 1080p that takes full advantage of today's large HDTVs, but you usually can hardly tell the difference between 720p and 1080p.In terms of features, the SZ-12 has pretty much everything that some of the much more expensive Olympus cameras have (like the $350 Tough TG-810 or so). The controls are simple and easy to figure out. While the camera is described as "stunningly sleek and stylish," the SZ-12 is really an inch and a half thick, and a full 3.5 inches with the lens fully motored out. It's still very handy, though, and the film camera-like bulge on the right side makes for a good grip.While the SZ-12 looks like it's solid metal, it's really plastic and actually feels a bit, dare I say it, on the cheapish side. And a couple of other blemishes: the battery doesn't last as long as I'd like, and the camera tends to oversaturate color.Overall, the Olympus SZ-12 offers an awful lot for not much money, and the good greatly outweighs the few issues. I'd buy this one again.

Reviews.Title: Superb Digital Camera Can Do it All
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: My perspectives on the Olympus SZ-12 camera derive from my extensive photographic experience--mostly and formerly with 35-mm technologies (last century)--in photographing biological and scientific subjects; wild plants, vegetation communities, etc. I am an accomplished photographer of such subjects.In summary, the Olympus SZ-12 digital camera is unsurpassed in almost every regard. It is relatively inexpensive, it is feature-packed (and the features actually function well), it is small, and the camera is easy to use. It is superbly designed. For those who wish to utilize advanced telephoto lenses (this camera has a 35-mm equivalent 600mm lens--which is a gigantic telephoto), along with wide-angle shots (this camera has a 35-mm equivalent 25mm lens, which is a wonderfully broad wide-angle, seldom found on cameras of this size and price), the lens capabilities, alone, set this camera apart.But more important than the long telephoto lens is the camera's dual image stabilization system, which works extremely well. I am able to take clear, unblurred telephoto closeups in rather low light, and often hand-held. Of course, it's always best to use a tripod, or at least prop the arm and camera against a tree or solid object before snapping a long telephoto shot, to minimize image motion at high magnifications. But this camera allows you to grab close-in telephotos at long lens lengths with remarkable clarity. In bright overcast and sunny clear skies, hand-held full length telephotos turn out exceptionally well. Now perhaps I'm better at keeping the camera fixed and still when snapping long telephoto shots, as I'm a very good rifle marksman. Still, the image stabilization system of this camera is superb.And it also allows the taking of normal, non-telephoto shots in lower light conditions, hand-held. The combination of wide angle to long telephoto, coupled with its superb image stabilization systems allow the taking of photos in reduced light or distant placements that few other cameras can--and no other camera matches these capabilities at the modest price of the Olympus SZ-12. The wide angle and telephoto capabilities are unmatched.I like the camera controls layout. They are about as intuitive as possible. A real problem I've encountered on other cameras is a confusion between still photography and movie photography controls. On some other digital cameras I've used, I've inadvertently begun to shoot a video sequence, when I thought I was taking my preferred still shot. Very frustrating. Not so with this Olympus, where the video start button is clearly marked (different, bright color) and located separately from the still shot controls. Well designed. Thank you, Olympus. When I want to shoot some video, I can easily press the right key. Otherwise, I never inadvertently touch it.All the other features and controls are similar to other digital cameras in the $200 price range. No, the camera does not shoot RAW images, only JPEG. But at 14MB, images are finely detailed. Color renditions are superb. I have not used the flash feature, so I have no comment on its functionality--but I do like the ease with which automatic flash can be turned and left off.Frankly, this little wonder has all the capabilities of the three 35-mm single lens reflex cameras I used to use to shoot wildlife and nature photos in my business (as a biologist). Now, with a single small camera kept in a cheap little nylon case, I can shoot macro closeups without any supplemental lens, and turn in an instant and shoot a flying bald eagle two hundred yards away, bringing her right into the image. With the super-macro feature, I can quickly and easily fill a frame with a full-sized bee or wasp, several feet away. The images are quickly recorded on the card, which is instantly and easily retrieved and plugged into the photo-card shot on my computer for instant download.For those who wish only to point and shoot, or for those more experienced with variable zoom lens and atypical photographic subjects, this camera can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: better than I was expecting
Reviews.Author: mwolfe83
Reviews.Content: Folks really push Nikon and Canon so I was a little worried about getting Olympus. (My wife liked it) I have had an Olympus dslr in the past and I can't say anything bad about it.  Anyway, it is a good little camera.24X zoom: great to have that ability but if you don't know how to use a camera pushed to 24x zoom, then don't bash the camera for it.  You are not going to get great results if there isn't a bunch of light at 24x.iauto:  when you first turn the camera on, it defaults to P (program) mode which gives you full control over the settings.  switch over to iauto and let the software do that for you.  If you are buying this camera, you probably are looking for a point and shoot. I read a review where someone complained about bad shots and I think that might be why. The camera will stay there until you change it again.Flash: the flash has to be flipped out manually but this isn't a bad thing.  I kind of like it that way. beats trying to find it on a menu when you really want to turn off/on the flash.  Just get in the habit of flipping that little switch as it is powering on and you are set.Magic filters: kind of dumb but you have them if you want them.  would be great if they were apple iPad filter quality.Video: there is a button for that.... great idea!  no fumbling through menus. The quality is good.Display:  the pictures seem a little bleached out on the little back screen but when you get them imported into picasa or some other photo management system, they look great.14MP: I played around with the other MP settings on the camera and I really couldn't see any difference between 8 or 14 MP.  Granted, all I was doing was zooming in.  I wasn't printing any picture.quick:  The camera seems quick unless there is low light.  in low light, the pictures take longer to shoot because the shutter has to stay open longer to gather enough light.  this makes for smeary pics if you have a moving target.. This isn't specific to Olympus, just a note I wanted to throw out there.OverallWe have had the camera for about a week now and I don't have any complaints.  A great deal of the technology in Olympus's DSLR's I have found to be available on this camera.  you have to get used to their interface but that is to be expected.  I will update this review if we have any problems with the camera.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: molly j
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera a few days ago. I didn't buy it online...ran across it in Walmart of all places....and it was $10 cheaper. Most stores don't even stock this camera yet. I was looking for a small pocket camera that I could carry around w/ me. This camera is a gem! I love the filters on it.....the reflection and sparkle are great. But it is a great camera in general. I've had Olympus cameras in the past and been happy with them. I wasn't sure what I wanted, but what I didn't want was to spend too much.....this camera packs so much in for the price...buy it, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: E Wally
Reviews.Content: I just took this camera to England and Scotland and it was perfect!! Took some wonderful pictures with it! The Zoom is AMAZING!! Can take good pictures of things far away! Very good size as well. Not too bulky and it fit in my camera case and was easy to carry around. The picture quality was great as well! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a good camera with a high zoom and affordable price. The only thing I wish it did was take better pictures of things moving, it came out a bit blurry.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 14MP Digital Camera with 24x Wide-Angle Zoom
Reviews.Author: Lil_Kitten7
Reviews.Content: Nice compact size and I love the finger grip on the front on the right hand side. I have taken about 40 pic's with it indoors and outdoors. The pic's are very,very good and being a passenger in my roomates truck taking pic's going down the road,it stops the movement very well. I've seen a few other reviews on here that say their pic's don't turn out good and their blurry and I'm pretty sure it's just a case of not having it set on the right settings. I have taken pic's for over 30 years and the first good camera I had was the old time 35mm Film SLR Cannon AE1 Camera with interchangable lenses back in 1980 and it's all about learning the right settings for the conditions. This is an awesome little camera ! The zoom is great !------------------------------------------------------------------UpDate : Well finally got outside and the one thing I have noticed about the zoom is that anywhere past 20x when taking pictures of birds,rabbits ect it come's out blurry. When you look at the picture it looks ok,but when you zoom in you can see the blur. This was a major disapointment to me as I love to take animal pictures. :( ..... I tried all different setting and no matter what the blur is still there. However, if you just like regular shots and don't go past 20x then it's not bad...................................................So needless to say I'm going to be getting a different camera. Have seen good reviews on the Nikon Coolpix L820 16 MP Digital Camera with 30x Zoom. It's a fairly small camera which is what I'm looking for, so going to be getting one to see.

Reviews.Title: Baptism in fire for this little camera.
Reviews.Author: Rusted Nut Garage
Reviews.Content: My Impressions of the Olympus SZ 12 Digital Camera.I have been looking to update my Digital Camera for some time and after quite a bit of research I opted for the Olympus SZ 12.  Probably the factors that drew me to it were the small form factor, relatively low cost, and large zoom.After a few weeks of trial and error I threw the camera in a suitcase and flew off to Maui to document a ceremony and do a little whale watching.  Yep, fly or die, I will soon know if the purchase was prudent.The short answer is that this is a good little camera, with just a few things standing between good and great. One of my first compromises was the lack of a range finder, contrary to what they would like you to believe, those LCD's are hard to see when you get out into the bright sunlight.  Not impossable but difficult was my conclusion.I also compromised on my AA battery requirement.  The Li 50B battery that came with the camera does not have particularly good life (50 or 60 pictures maybe).  If you purchase one of these cameras then you should also pickup the external charger and batteries for $14.95.Do not get taken in by the impressive zoom (24X).  There is no way you are going to be able to hand hold this camera and get a good clear shot when shooting at 24X!  You will however get a shot, just do not expect a lot.  The Auto Focus is also very marginal when you get out at long distances.Like the great majority of digital cameras It struggles a lot when you attempt to take pictures in low light conditions without the flash.  However the flash pictures are very good.In the automatic mode this little camera does a pretty good job of getting the correct exposure for most situations.  There are an impressive number of filtered settings that are easy to use and work pretty well.  Outdoors it does a pretty good job of rendering colors and produces very good results.Ergonomically this small camera has probably one of the best designs I have ever seen.  I spent some time trying to open the small rubber cover on the back of the camera until I realized it was meant to be a grip rest for my thumb.  The shape of the case facilitates one hand operation.I would recommend downloading the user manual that comes on the CD and give it a good through read.  There is a lot of features in this little camera and a cruse through the manual would be helpful.So if you are not Ansel Adams and you are looking for a good little grab shot camera you might give this camera a good long look.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera
Reviews.Author: Benja
Reviews.Content: An excelent camera for the price. Great Pictures. Buy an extra battery because you can use 2 of them in one day

Reviews.Title: amazing zoom, easy menu, bit bulky - happy buyer
Reviews.Author: whatcanisay

} } } Length:: 1:07 MinsFor a hundred and fifty bucks (Jan2013), it's a good deal for a camera with 24x zoom. The zoom has a soft grinding sound when zooming in or out, but not irritating unless you're recording a symphony orchestra. Has 29 minutes limit for recording any video at the max HD, unless you go for lower resolution for longer recording. Audio recording is quite loud enough for conversation in a 20x20 room.The panorama feature is easy. It provides a small star icon on the sides of each shot and you pan camera to link new shot to the previous star. But the final output of a panorama shot is smaller than a normal shot; so enlargement is quite limited. E.g. when taking 3 panorama shots, you are compressing 3 pictures into one.The latch on door to battery/SD card compartment underneath is tiny, using finger nail to open/shut. Be careful not to inadvertently open it.Photos are sharp when my hands don't shake too much. Colors are true to life. Conclusion, unless using a tripod, when using zoom, the steadier your hands, the sharper the photos. The greater you zoom in, the more vulnerable you are to shaky videos.

Reviews.Title: Point, shoot ... aaaahhhhhh
Reviews.Author: MarcyW
Reviews.Content: This camera has a great zoom. It also has lots of settings you can play around with, if you want. But you can also set it on iauto and get great pics every time. I like the bright red color because it makes it very hard to leave behind. ;0)

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Sbrell
Reviews.Content: I just got the camera and am surprised with the options in this little Jen. I had a Nikon for more $ which died just after the warranty expired. To repair it was more than to replace it - which is why I got this camera. It is a nice size - will still fit in jacket pocket and the zoom is fantastic. If you are looking for a light weight (plastic shell) camera with lots of options and excellent zoom  - this is it.

Reviews.Title: Good, not perfect
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love the 24x wide angle zoom.  the image stabilization is adequate.  Size is convenient.  There is some software glitch that causes it to freeze periodically.  the viewscreen is still active, so you can't tell it is frozen until you try to change something or shoot a picture.  Pop the battery out to reboot it.  All is well.

Reviews.Title: Like the Camera So Far - Have a Question
Reviews.Author: DanC NJ
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera, and after playing around with it for an hour or so, I really like it. The features that are packed into this compact camera are impressive to say the least. It's a very well thought out design. The controls are very friendly, I especially like the flash release. It has enough manual settings in program mode to satisfy me for when IAuto isn't doing the job.  The performance indoors, even without the flash is outstanding. I will update this review when I have used the camera more, but I have a question I hope someone can answer.When I press the shutter release halfway down, the camera makes a buzzing/static like noise while auto focusing. It might be normal for this camera, but I'm not sure, and I am trying to decide if I should return it. I've owned many digital cameras, and I've never had one make this kind of noise when focusing.EDIT to ADD: The dual image stabilization is what is making all the noise. It has 3 settings in the menu, on...off.... and ...while exposing. Mine came with it set on from the factory, but for photo shooting, it should be set to "while exposing." I can't hear the noise at all now except for when I intentionally set it for a very long exposure in night scene mode. I will turn it "on" when shooting video, but oddly enough the camera is completely silent when shooting video.I would highly recommend this camera. It's a good size, a little larger than a standard compact, but much smaller than the larger P&S; models. It can be slow to focus at times, but that is to be expected for a camera in this price range, I paid 149 new, w/free shipping. The images are better than I'd expected, again, considering the price. The flash is adequate for what it is intended, and well designed. The battery performs well, but an additional battery and external charger are a good investment, and can be found very inexpensive on Amazon.I've upped my review to 5 stars. I don't see how anyone could ask for more than 14MP, and 24X zoom in a compact design at this price point, that consistently produces accurate exposures in most situations. This camera is not my best camera, but will get much more use than my Pen E-PL1 because of it's convenient size and versatility.

Reviews.Title: Quite a disappointment
Reviews.Author: cnyadan
Reviews.Content: I'm a daily camera user, and I got this on special to replace a Canon camera with similar specs because the Canon's flash no longer works.  Unfortunately, 3 months later, I'm back to using the Canon more often than this camera.Now, the SZ-12 does do decently outside, both in daytime and at night.  However, I was looking for a camera that would take nice pictures indoors as well, particularly of kids (who don't stay still to pose).In any case, for a long time, I just thought I was missing something, and over the last couple of months, I have been through all sorts of settings, and nothing seems to help much.  I am already now looking for something to replace this one.Right away, I noticed that the camera almost sounded like it was grinding inside to adjust the zoom.  I looked this up, and supposedly this is "normal".  The other thing that I noticed right off is that although the file sizes are 80% larger than my Canon (also 14mp) it is a lot less sharp, and if one needs to shrink the file size, say for email, the picture starts looking pixellated right away.  Even with my 5.1mp camera, I never had that happen so badly.The flash on this camera is too bright - if you take pictures inside, it makes it look like the whole room - except for what the flash hits - is a dungeon.  The flash then is too bright on the subject.  It's so uneven, that if one uses the camera vertically, it's noticeable as to what side of the subject the flash was on.  Also, any picture on a subject that is less than half a room away will look washed out.  I think I've gotten severe red-eye on every single picture I've taken with this camera of people indoors, even with the "red eye" function, which itself is a joke.  The red-eye function, instead of being a red light that flashes along with the flash, ends up being some sort of "pre-flash" - if you can imagine, kind of a "fluttering" light, then a pause of about a second, then the "real" flash.  So, forget trying to get pictures of kids with this (even if it would work), because they don't sit around just to have pictures taken.  (Hence, blurry & unfocused pictures.)The focus on this thing is horrible.  I take pictures, look on the screen, many look lovely, then later, I get them on the computer, and they are really grainy and often nothing is focused very well.  I've taken pictures at three occasions so far involving birthday cake, and every single one of those pictures looked horrible - so much so that I could tell on the screen - and no setting seems to be able to rectify this.  Many times, this camera makes solid color walls look kind of like those old 1970's shag rugs, which were made up of fibers of many different shades of a color.I contacted Olympus about the camera, and after explaining the problem, and sending them examples, they said I could send the camera in for "evaluation".  Well, it turns out that I probably no longer have the receipt, and so it seems that I have absolutely no recourse here.  I can guarantee you, though, I will never be buying an Olympus product again.

Reviews.Title: Not for concerts or night lighting
Reviews.Author: Susan J. Brillhart "Kid nurse"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on sale Sept 2012 to be my general camera - but also for concerts. Was excited about the zoom and quality of pictures and video on the reviews.  Um - wrong. Several major issues - there is no stabilizer on video - so,if handheld when zoomed, it will look like you were shooting during an earthquake and make people seasick.  Truly unable to watch for long or post on Youtube (private setting). A tripod is absolutely necessary for zoomed video.  Second - the vertical column distortion was amazingly awful.  Bruce Springsteen concert - the video of the stage looks like a modern art painting - quite impressive, except I wanted concert video and not modern art. I showed it to my brother, who is an optical engineer, and he was really impressed at how bad the column distortion was (sometimes a cm wide).  Apparently, Olympus is using older-model sensors that bleed easily into other columns.  Never saw it with my $150 Panasonic Lumix DMC-LZ10. Ever.  And, to top it off the sound was mediocre and the low light pics were usually blurry.Amazon had a lightening deal on the Canon Powershot SX230HS three weeks later.  Took both cameras to a concert.  Sat back row of Radio City Music Hall, 2nd Mezzanine.  Nice and dark, and far away from the stage.  Took pics and video.  Zoomed tight, medium and wide - and returned the Olympus the next day.  Powershot had outstanding zoom - and stabilization on video, great sound, nice low-light pictures - and is incredibly compact for that much camera.  Outshone the Olympus in every way.  And, on lightening deal, was cheaper!  VERY happy with the Powershot.  And truly disappointed with the Olymus SZ-12.

Reviews.Title: Slow recovery time
Reviews.Author: Jules
Reviews.Content: I like the picture quality.  Haven't had time to learn how to use all the settings, but I do know that I'm frustrated with the slow recovery time.  When I'm taking pictures of the kids and they have to hold a pose for 5-7 seconds between pictures they get awfully cranky. :) I've missed a lot of good shots because of the slow recovery time. I do love the zoom feature, it's awesome!  I've had a hard time taking pictures in inadequate light situations but I think that's partly or mostly my fault because I haven't learned how to use the proper settings.

Reviews.Title: Handy Camera
Reviews.Author: D
Reviews.Content: I got the camera yesterday and was able to go through its features.  Since I already have an ultra zoom (24x) I was looking for one with less bulk.  The Olympus SZ12 was perfect.  The pictures are clear even at the high end of the zoom, it has a great macro and some neat filters, the settings are easily accessed.  It's a very handy camera to carry around all the time for "unplanned photos".  I would recommend this product to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I ever bought.
Reviews.Author: Book Author Tabitha R. Pike "tabithapike dot net"
Reviews.Content: My sister bought one of these cameras and I simply fell in love with all the features and had to buy me one. I love the sleek red, which is my favorite color of course but that is not all. I love the HD video recording features and the picture quality. I have owned a lot of cameras in my time but I have never owned one I loved as much as this one. It has an automatic beauty enhancer built in, sparkle, and so many other functions. I enjoy not having to upload my pics then edit them. The pictures automatically look great. I would say, If you are buying a camera, you wont regret buying this one. It is perfect for every thing. It has functions, for snow, pets, sports, night time portraits, plus hundreds more.

Reviews.Title: Failed miserably
Reviews.Author: Dini's Mom "Dini's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I am a mom with 3 young children and don't know very much about photography, but I am tech savvy. I did what others said, and got the higher class SDHC card, etc. I got this Olympus to replace a 4-5 year old Canon Powershot, just because I wasn't happy with the slowness of the Canon in between shots. The shots on the Olympus LCD looked okay, but when we downloaded them, it was a different story. They had fuzzy backgrounds and the colors were washed out.  Any movement at all (even a tapping toe) came out so blurry, the pic wasnt worth keeping.  The zoom is great - but you wont get a decent pic with it!  I tried every setting (which, but the way is not easy to get to using the menu) and it just couldn't take a darn pic!  For fun, I loaded the new memory card into my old Canon. The old 8 MP Canon outperformed by a mile.  I went with Olympus because I loved my Camedia camera years ago, but this one is lacking HUGE.  I don't want to have to a) make sure my flash is up and b) make sure you have a good setting that uses flash. Kids DO NOT wait around for pictures, let alone for you to fiddle with the menu. This may be good for someone that has 30 seconds to "set up" a shot, but I'm missing some major milestones with my kids.  I did a ton of research and unfortunately listened to the wrong reviews.  I'm now sold on Canon's image stabilization from 5 years ago - Olympus does not have the same technology.  It's been returned. Goodbye, Olympus. I'll never cheat on Canon again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera -- little nag
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Mtn Guy"
Reviews.Content: This camera produces great photos and is easy to use.The only nagging thing about it is that the USB Cable connection in the camera is proprietary -- I thought it was a mini-USB connector, but it is not.  They should have used a standard connector, mini or micro, so all the USB cables we have would work.Now, I'm sure that someday I will be on a trip and not have the proper cable with me and a replacement won't be easy to find.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Rohla "DR."
Reviews.Content: I got this camera about 5 days ago! The battery is great! It can last me a long time! The best thing about the battery is that it doesn't take batteries...it comes with a camera battery and a charger! It's bittersweet because then I don't have to carry around batteries..but then again, if the camera's battery dies, then you have to charge it...so the battery is bittersweet!Picture Quality is pretty good! I like it!Overall, I like it! The zoom is GREAT!!! The screen is great! The battery is great!  I really like this camera! I would recommend it! :DUPDATE:::I've had it for about 2 weeks! It's still good except for one thing! I went to the aquarium and I found out it takes bad underwater shots! Unless the fish is totally still, the shot will be blurry! All of my dolphin pictures were terrible!!! I was disappointed! :( But otherwise, it's still a good camera! However, I think it might be cheap because the top of my flash is cracking already....So I will have to check that later....

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 Camera
Reviews.Author: Janis Barber
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews about this camera I purchased it from Amazon. It has a lot of features and settings including 3D, but I mostly use the auto standard settings. The 24x Wide-Angle Zoom takes great close-up shots from a distance, or just to get a nice close-up of something close.  The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because of the little plastic wheel that turns to the settings. It is too easy to bump it with your finger and it will get on the wrong setting without realizing it. It is a nice-size that can fit well in your purse or pocket. It has a rounded grip on the right side that makes it easy to hold onto. It comes with a cord that hooks on the camera for your wrist, and I guess you could hook a lanyard on to wear around your neck. The battery life seems okay and you have to charge the battery while in the camera from a wall charger that comes with it.  It is a nice camera for the price and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera - Good zoom.
Reviews.Author: D. Patton
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like about this camera is the type battery it uses.  I am used to using cameras that use rechargeable double A batteries.  Other than that, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: bigmammahog
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take picture of our daughter barrel racing.  I couldn't have paid thousands of dollars and got a better camera.  It took a little practice with the action shots but I finally got it down and now get wonderful results.  The video feature is great too.  Pictures are so clear and beautiful even in low light.  Bought with the intention of upgrading but I don't think I will...I'll just keep this one and save the money!!

Reviews.Title: Incredible!!!
Reviews.Author: Leon De Vose, II "Pursuing the Character of J...
Reviews.Content: Olympus SZ-12 14MP Digital Camera with 24x Wide-Angle Zoom (Black)I bought this camera in May, 2012, from a national chain "brick & mortar" I have used it most recently at two concerts, and kept to each event's photo/video restrictions.  Both were at the same venue - the New Jersey Performing Arts Center in Newark, NJ.  Each time I was about the same distance from the stage.The Parliament/Funkadelic Concert with Morris Day in Fall of 2012 announced and enforced no video restrictions.  I have several video clips where I shot wide to zoom.  The quality of the footage was better than I expected.  I say this, because this camera was the most affordable successor, with the features that I had missed  from Lumix ZS-5 that decided to shut down on me in 2011 after three years of (sometimes very rough and rugged) service.  I paid about $180 for it.  At any rate, the focus was excellent, and the sound was between good and excellent.  Take note that I am doubly cursed.  I was a hard-core film photographer (35mm SLR, 6x6/6x7 cm rangefinder, SLR, TLR)  until my son gave me a Kodak digital camera for Christmas in 2004 which changed my life as a photographic artist.  I am also a performer and composer with a Rutgers degree in music.  Quality of both images and sound are anal issues for me, so when I say the sound and video were good, others would probably say excellent.I attended a concert by Earth, Wind and Fire in May, 2013, also at the New Jersey Performing Arts Center.  This concert had flash and video prohibitions.  The images (all with no flash) were breathtaking whether zoom or wide - even when there was a lot of conflict of light, shadow and contrast.  These shots were more of a challenge, and made me use my hard-learned photographer skills, but the shots were the envy of the group of folks who attended with my wife and me.This camera is made for the snapshooter and the sharpshooter alike.  There is something for everyone in this little box.  Picture quality, recovery time, features, modes - I love this camera, and writing this review has helped me to decide to go ahead and buy one for my son for his 29th birthday.  I originally wrote this as a response to a somewhat negative review by consumer Susan Brillhart regarding concert and nighttime video and still images.One thing I will add as a tip to anyone buying ANY camera.  You have to go ahead and experiment with every feature and mode.  The camera (least of all this one) will not blow up or turn to dust in your hand or a worthless piece of plastic.  You have to try the various shooting modes, the "smart" image modes, the panorama, "trick" or "magic" or whatever modes, with & without flash, full program mode,  video, light-balance, digital zoom, etc.  ISO is a most important feature to understand. The higher you set it, the lower the light requirement for a decent image.  However, the tradeoff is the higher the ISO you use, the less resolution (or more graininess)you will have. It costs you nothing now.Some of you are, as I, converted film photographers with at least two different format film rigs in a closet somewhere.  You remember when it co$t film and proce$$ing co$t$ to test the limits and abilities of their rigs.  That could be real money.  With digital, you can play with the various settings to see what they do, upload them to your PC (or MAC) look at them, learn from them, and either keep your goofs as interesting backgrounds (as have I) or delete them.  The more you know of what the camera can (or cannot) do, the more you will appreciate its value (or lack thereof) - and all it cost you was time.And this is all I will say.  I could, as you can probably see, go on and on, but I  will stop here.  Suffice it to say that the Olympus SZ-12 14MP Digital Camera with 24x Wide-Angle Zoom (Black) is a great camera at great price.  You get more than what you pay for with this camera.  I mean, even with its Leica glass, the Lumix is like an old fiancee.  Great, wonderful, indispensible  - in its time.Feel free to ask questions.  I love sharing what I have learned, and will be happy to help you avoid any mines of misery.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Nota Bene
Reviews.Content: You'll spend hundreds of more dollars to match the features of the Olympus SZ-12. While you can point and shoot in full automatic mode this camera has many optional features that will prepare you for your dSLR when the time comes.  Before you buy another camera compare the specifications.  Nothing matches the SZ-12 in its price range.  Get ready to have fun!

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Amit
Reviews.Content: Bought two of these camera's a silver and a black, one for my self and the other for my nephew. He saw mines and fell inlove with it. It has alot of cool features such as the Panorama shot and 3D. You can also adjust it to your personal settings or set it to auto. The zoom feature is amazing and the flash is just a click away. I took this camera to a school reunion and everyone loved it. It took out awesome pictures without the flash at night. They said i have a "CSI" camera......LOL.  The silver is really flashy and good looking. Two things i don't like about it is the way the battery has to be charged. Like the past sony i had you could have removed the battery and charge it, with this one you have to leave the battery in the camera and jack in a usb cord to the power outlet and the camera so you have to be careful where you place your camera especially if you have kids like myself. Another thing is i wish the screen was a little more indented or flat, In terms of battery life its last really long a couple days if you're using it frequently.I would recommend this product to anyone. Because of the way the battery has to be charged i will give this product a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom, OK pictures, long reset
Reviews.Author: Jerimiah
Reviews.Content: I've had the camera two months and it is a good deal for the money but it has a major fault. It takes a very long time to reset for the next shot. (reset, refresh, cycle?) The pictures are fine but not as good as my Canon powershot. The zoom is really incredible for such a small camera. Fit and finish present as cheap but on examination it is becomes better.  The camera fits easily in one hand and feels secure and balanced.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price, but not comparable to top of the line cameras
Reviews.Author: A. Simpson
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera is good. I use a DSLR for my professional work, but I wanted a point and shoot for a research job that I have. It's easy to stick in my pocket and has a long zoom, which I need. The quality is not comparable to a top of the line camera, but if you just need a camera for snapshots, then this will do the trick. I have not liked motion or flash-pictures taken with the camera so far, but I use my pro camera for portraits or sports. Also, I didn't have any luck with the iAuto function...the photos were weird. Probably the neatest feature is that pet face recognition function. When the camera identifies a cat or dog face, it will automatically take the photo. Pretty cool if you have a pet.

Reviews.Title: Good Pix, Easy and Fun to Use - Olympus Has a Winner Here
Reviews.Author: Richard Brookes "Rumpled Writer"
Reviews.Content: Quite an amazing camera for less than $100. I am a semi-professional photographer (sell pictures but do not make my living as a photographer) and have over 40 years experience taking pictures.  This camera is very capable for an inexpensive device.  I am very impressed with the functionality and simplicity of the unit.  It is very user friendly and produces good results.  I have two Nikon DSLRs and, to be frank, for casual shots, I much prefer the Olympus.  Not to say that the Olympus images are the equal of the Nikon's but they are excellent for the price.  The 24X zoom lens is amazing.  Kudos to Olympus for their optics.  It is not easy to design a lens with this range and get acceptable images.  The camera is small and pocketable and the lens is protected by retracting when the camera is powered off.  One caveat: the set up controls are very sensitive and my ham handed fingers selected the wrong language.  The menu was gibberish to me but Olympus online help set me straight quickly. Good to know they are so accommodating.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't make you look fat!! Super shutter speed and excellent Zoom!!
Reviews.Author: sheeba
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the price. Some cams make pictures look more round and the scene look more deeper, thus making you look fat. (To know what I mean you can see the difference in photographs taken from an Iphone and Samsung or Nokia phone, you would look more round on Samsung or Nokia cam). Olympus cams never make you look fat!! And it has super shutter speed so that you dont miss out any moments and has excellent Zoom!!

Reviews.Title: olympus sz-12
Reviews.Author: Stephen Waer
Reviews.Content: very good quality for the price, the digital zoom is very sensitive to movement. a better stabilization system would help

Reviews.Title: More blurry pictures
Reviews.Author: Mom First
Reviews.Content: I am not a camera expert.  I really want a camera that takes great quality pictures with minimal adjustment.  The zoom on this camera is great which is what ultimately prompted me to buy this camera.  The pictures it can take in low light without a flash are impressive....when they turn out.  I have been having difficulty with many of my pictures coming out blurry.  I probably delete 20% of my pictures just because they are blurred.  I adjusted the stabilization to the highest setting.  This helped but didn't fix the problem.  Using the flash does result in better quality however often it is too bright because the camera does so well with low light.  Again, I am no camera expert; there may be a setting I am missing but this is not quite the 'easy with great quality' I have found in other point-and-shoots.

Reviews.Title: Almost 2 Good 2 Be True
Reviews.Author: Mauro serrano
Reviews.Content: Pros: Where do I start? If you don't want to learn all the mumbo jumbo set it to IA (intelligent auto) and it figures out how to make it work PERIOD. Even in medium light it does well with no flash. It never flashes unless you click the flash button and the flash literally pops up. It has amazing "dual stabilization" that lets you get away without a flash if you can hold reasonably still. The screen is SUPER bright and easy to see anywhere. If you are trying to take a picture that should have a flash it will alert you & you can decide to use it (for a picture less than 20' away) or just hold still and be surprised.IF you want features, muscle and options this thing will make you cry tears of joy.With 24x OPTICAL zoom my kids faces are crystal clear at the school program. Zooms all the way in our kid from the seats half way back in a 300 person auditorium. It rocks for football and is 100% functional in 720p HD video mode. The wide angle has a 70 degree field of view. In other words from the corner of a room you can capture 77% of the room. Any wider and you get the "fish eye" distortion. Then there is macro for stuff less than like 3 feet and super macro for stuff less than an inch (yes, really).There are many modes that remember how you set them. True panoramic (I zoomed in on my daughter's class choir to get faces top to bottom and made a true panoramic view right to left at like 10x zoom including every student in hi res)Other modes include 3d, magic / special effects, Scene (fireworks, beach, snow etc) IA - intelligent auto as mentioned above, and my favorite as a nerd P for programmable.This baby has a setting called in the Programmable mode. H, H1, and H2. These take consecutive pictures as long as you hold the shutter (H= click, click, H1 = 2x as fast (multiple pics per second at 3mpx) and H2 = as near high speed as this can go (speed depends on megapixels the lower the faster). I just tested H2 and got over 10 pics per second for 4 seconds. You may have heard those pro cameras that have an SLR lens that can sound like a deck of cards being shuffled at media and sports events. Similar deal. Here is the kicker. It can only hold so much info in Ram so at H1 7 seconds is max shoot time on high speed consecutive shots. But it takes 6 shots a second. I just tested it on the clock's second hand. Then your camera is basically disabled while it is writing to SD card for 80 seconds if you filled the the entire ram. Much less if not. I've never before needed 7 seconds of high speed but it's there if you do. I photograph lots of birds at our feeder and this mode is SUPERB for getting good shots of those fast moving birds, even in flight. There is NO WAIT if you don't fill the RAM completely. You can grab 2 seconds, and then grab 2 more a second later with no delay (on H1). Looking forward to High Speed my son in football.So there it is. No kitchen sink but talk about bang for your buck. OH YEAH!!Cons: The dual stabilizing lenses can be heard on video when recording in silence. That feature can be shut off but I'd rather have a steady picture than worry about a sound you only hear in a silent room.Flash must be opened or it will just take good pics without unless you are real in real low light. The flash pops up when you hit a button. Forget to push the button and no flash.When shooting high speed stills at 4 or 10 pics per second (at 3 mpx) if you fill the ram (shoot for over 7 seconds non stop) the camera's memory or ram needs to unload to your sd card. This takes 80 seconds and you just have to wait (or take high speed in 4 second bursts with a few seconds in between and there is NO delay at all).It wasn't free.no kitchen sink or toaster720p hi def instead of 1080. I guess I'm old. I don't see the dif.Will not operate on USB power with a dead battery.Not sure if there is any alternative to that exact rechargeable battery (even though it works well) it would be nice to be able to pop in a couple AAs as some camera rechargeables allow. Not sure if that type would hold as much power. This has a bright screen and constant motion inside while shooting as the 2 stabilizing lenses never stop while your finger is on the shutter or recording video. I imagine it would eat AAs like tic tacs.Other Thoughts: PS. I got the red one which I didn't see anymore so I put my review on the same make and model in black.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 -- a fun camera to own
Reviews.Author: Aussie
Reviews.Content: I have been using this Olympus camera for two months and am finding that it provides quality photographs while being able to easily access numerous options. My favorite is having the ability to manually set the functions in order to improve on the attributes of a photo. I also use a Nikon 5200 which I have had for a couple of years and use for more serious shooting. However, because of the compactness and versatility of the Olympus, I am tending to pack it with me all of the time and take the Nikon for those intense photographic encounters. The Olympus also seems to be more durable than the Nikon Coolpix cameras which I have had as they did not hold up to being packed around in a pocket or purse. Even though the Olympus weighs a bit more thank the Coolpix, for my use, the difference is worth it if it is not so fragile. In summary -- an excellent choice in compact cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great zoom but the flash leaves a little to be desired
Reviews.Author: lukinagin
Reviews.Content: Overall I love the camera.  The compact size and the zoom make it a significant upgrade over my last point and shoot.  My only complaint is the flash.  I would think Olympus could set the flash up so it would pop-up automatically when needed.  Instead, all I get is a warning on the screen telling me I need the flash.  I then have to manually pop-up the flash myself before taking my picture.  Seems a little antiquated and hopefully something Olympus can address in a future release of this, otherwise, very nice camera.

Reviews.Title: Ok fair
Reviews.Author: D. Kennedy
Reviews.Content: low light pictures are grainyThe flash is ok up to 8 feet awayBright sun pictures are very good

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: freddie LeDoux
Reviews.Content: I am an Inspector, and I need good clear pictures in a lighted area a non lighted area, at the same time. This camera does ever thing I need plus some. It is not heavy, and easy to handle. The instructions are very detailed and the camera functions are easy to understand. The only thing I wish it had is a way to hook a neck strap. I would buy another, if I needed one.

Reviews.Title: Good camera.
Reviews.Author: unclee0518
Reviews.Content: It is a very good camera. The 24x zoom is definitely a help. I am still learning all of its aspects but it seems like it will serve my needs well.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Colleen
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It will fit in my coat pocket, so when I am out and about I can carry it with me and still catch those great shots. The rechargeable battery saves money also! I am very satisfied with this purchase and purchased one for my mother as well.Now if she has questions, I can pull out my camera and figure out how to help her.

Reviews.Title: Ordering a Second One!
Reviews.Author: nonsensely
Reviews.Content: I ordered one of these from HSN (SZ-11) in 2011 for my son and daughter-in-law.  Last summer, I went on a walking tour of Tuscany (fabulous, in case you ever thought about doing something like that), and didn't want to lug my huge Olympus DSLR setup around every day.  Since they were living with me at the time, I took their camera.It was so easy to use, set the mode - panaorama, auto, short videos, scenery (zoomed out and in), people, indoor shots of the churches and museums, etc.  A few shots were blurry - particularly where we were walking and I was just holding the camera up over my head and clicking away, and some of the indoor low light indoor ZOOMED shots as well (the Pieta :-{ ).  The battery held the charge for over two weeks and 1500 shots!!!  I was pleasantly surprised by this camera's performance.Not sure if this one comes with the Olympus software, but since my E-620 did, I just plugged in and uploaded using the Olympus Master software, which has editing capabilities as well, so if you don't like the color, balance,filters etc. used during shoot, you can change them once uploaded.The kids moved out a few months ago, so I need a good pocket type camera to keep in my purse. I'm totally sold on all Olympus products and am now ordering one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Love the optics!
Reviews.Author: J. Mactoodle "mactoodle"
Reviews.Content: Really great quality for the money.  I tend to play with the settings and have goofed that up a bit, but I'm sure I'll find answers to my questions the more I use the camera.  Really clear shots and just the right size to toss into my purse.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: commoner
Reviews.Content: I found this camera at Wal-Mart for $150.00 this week. So far I really like it. Going to take a while to learn all the different setting but that can be fun if you have time to play with it. The only thing I didn't like so far is the little door on the side I think it's cheap and may not last long. I reason I bought this model is the 24X zoom and I thought the pictures looked pretty good for the price. I haven't used the video yet.Update; The one thing I don't like is the camera doesn't come with a manual. Maybe that true of all cameras these days. There is a downloadable one but I miss that little book that came with the Canon I had in the past.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoors and sporting events
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Stea
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few weeks ago, and am stilling tinkering with the various functions and picture modes, but like what I see (so far), especially outdoors.  The camera is durable, and has 25x optical zoom, but still small enough to carry in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad camera..a few things could be better
Reviews.Author: Steve G. "Steve-in-Ky"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because I was looking for something compact to take hiking, paddling and to have just a pocket camera. Plus, for grab shots, it isn't practical to carry my dSLR around with me. As we like to paddle kayaks, I'd much rather get this wet than my more expensive camera.So, on to the merits of the camera. It has an extremely quick focus with no problems with shutter lag. The viewfinder is about typical in daylight shots. The video does a pretty good job. Obviously, these pics are not quite as good as my more expensive dSLR and video cameras, but I wouldn't expect them to be.I am impressed with the optical zoom. I keep the ISO set on 400, and it zooms quickly and focuses quickly on subjects, with a fast enough shutter speed to prevent blurring in most situations. I won't rehash what others have already written.My cons? I was using it on the second day, and noticed that where I had put it in and taken it out of a zippered case had put several scratches on the glass viewfinder. My thumb had rubbed several dull spots on the right side. Not cool. It's pretty obvious that the glass could have been better. I have since sacrificed one of my mil-spec tablet screen covers and solved the problem.I haven't printed any pics yet, so I can't advise as to the print quality. Some macro shots of a crab apple tree in blossom had good focus and color saturation.The video on a Facebook video was grainy at first, but if you click HD, it cleans up nicely to a sharp image. I guess it went down to low res for posting. A nice feature is that you can turn the mic off. For voice overs and music in editing, this is a good feature.I did get a Joby bending mini tripod for timer shots and videos. It wraps around stuff, and has seriously strong magnets, plus a panning handle.Anyway, for the money, I think it is a good camera that is small enough to take places as a backup, pocket camera, or for hiking and paddling. For paddling, I have a clear case from Wally World that has a gasket with snaps. It keeps it nice and dry, and has a hook to lash it to the cockpit. I can dream about a GoPro, but for now, my Oly does the trick.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 14MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Turner
Reviews.Content: Its a great camera, a product from an established and respected band and is easy to use, has an excellent zoom lens, is full of features and was offered at an excellent price.  Hard to go wrong !

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, video isn't good
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: The pictures this camera takes are phenominal. The problem is the audio when taking a video. The auto-focus mechanisms inside the camera are constantly going and make for a ton of background noise while taking video. The picture is fine but if you plan on just using the audio taken at the same time as the video then don't use this camera for your video uses

Reviews.Title: Powerhouse in a small package
Reviews.Author: Thomas R. Swartley
Reviews.Content: With 24x OPTICAL zoom and more digital if your that brave plus dual image stabilization this thing takes pretty amazing pictures at up to 14mp.  I photograph birds and enjoy the Program mode set to "HI1" that shoots four 5 mp shots per second till the built in memory is full (around 60 shots or so) then it reveals it's one somewhat frustrating flaw in that while it is writing info to the SD card you cannot take pictures. Another flaw is the vertical line that appears on video when you get the sun in frame on a snowy bright day. It overloads the CCD or something and you get a vertical white line. So....don't do that. It has only happened to me when taking video of sledding on a sunny winter day. Otherwise you can select "scene" and beach or snow and it clamps down on the brightness to produce first class photos. It has many built in "scenes" it does good 3D and great panoramic which is super user friendly. It shoot s 720p mono audio video. One annoyance is that the mic pics up the image stabilizing as it moves both an inner lens and the ccd itself (hence dual stabilization) so you hear a flutter on video when you are shooting video in a quiet place. However, you can always turn the sound off and in any venue like a game or choir concert you'll never hear it on the video (which is very smooth and steady even in semi shaky hands). This is my second SZ-12. The first was damaged when sent out with family to document an outing and they run the battery dead and tried to push the lens shut. DON'T DO THAT.  derrr.  In regard to the battery it is robust and lasts a LONG time on a single charge. I'm guessing you can shoot an hour of video on a single charge. Extra batteries are not hard to find nor expensive. I got a second thinking I'd need it with a charger for a reasonable price on line. I've never run the thing dry on my own. I think those I lent my last one too left it on between taking pics and the auto focus and very bright large screen may have run it down. Now that I think back it wasn't fully charged when they took it.  This camera is the only one in the price range that has over 20x optical zoom. The digital zoom has come a long way since the blocky days of 500x digital zoom on 8mm video cameras. I took some of the moon and people on fb were asking me what kind of camera I took it with. I set it to "night scene" and went full digital zoom, leaned against a tree and slowly squeezed off a couple and it came out really well including craters and the works all with maxed out optical and digital zoom. I don't use digital generally. 24x is plenty anyhow.  I've owned a pretty nice SLR 35mm with 305mm lens and lots of add ons. This outperforms that in both speed and quality.  I recommend it highly. But you can't have mine.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for The Money
Reviews.Author: Disciple1333
Reviews.Content: The pictures are crystal clear, the movies are Hi definition and the sound is very clear, the zoom is awesome for the price, there are cameras costing a lot more with a lot less features then this camera. It's a product with a great name and tradition of quality. I'm very pleased with My new Camera

Reviews.Title: The most perfect camera ever
Reviews.Author: Sarah Cuomo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I wanted to be able to capture perfect moments with my love ones. It does more than that! It takes awesome pictures & is so user friendly. Definitely worth the money!

Reviews.Title: Good camera with great zoom
Reviews.Author: CSK
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera from "Flander's Merchandise", They sent within 2 working days and I paid the least $117. they also shipped a camera case along for free :-).The camera is fast and able to capture good picture under low light.Zoom is great but you probably need a tripod for clear shot(this is common across all the camera when using more zoom).The one thing I don't like is the build quality which looks pure Plastic.But overall it is a good buy for this price.

Reviews.Title: Success with the camera
Reviews.Author: Elsbeth C. Purvis "Elsbethp"
Reviews.Content: I am not at all a camera whiz. I like to take pictures to remember where I've been or what we are doing. I was sold on this camera because it always takes pictures in the wide angle mode which I like. There are different mode settings depending on the type of shot. Read the directions to help you understand what they do. I had to practice taking different types of shots with the appropriate settings to make sure I knew what setting to use quickly. This really wasn't difficult, actually it was fun. I took great shots of my dogs during the practice time. Oh, did you know there is a setting that when the camera sees a dog, it will automatically take its picture. Same for cats. Wow. When we returned from graduation, I uploaded my Picts to the computer with an accessory...very easy to use. The whole process of getting my Picts to the computer was so simple and almost all my pictures turned out. The camera was not at fault for the bad ones, it was operator error!  Lol. Enjoy your camera

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: EZ
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've ever owned.  It even does decent video, which I wasn't looking for but have used to great success.  Even posted a vid of a favorite local band on FaceBook.

Reviews.Title: Love, Love, Love this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Judith L. Putnam
Reviews.Content: I take this camera almost every where I go. The pictures are great! I love the special effects. It is easy to use. I love it

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12
Reviews.Author: Dragon
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent camera for the price. works great.  Get it you cant beat it. I have three other older Olympus cameras they are still working good was time to update. works great with windows 8.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: Coco the Koi
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas present and the person who got it loves it.  Especially the rechargeable battery aspect of it!

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera!!! I cannot talk more highly about this camera, I bought this camera for my trip to Europe, I had an older Sony Camera which was fine nothing was wrong with it but only 8MP and 3X zoom which is nothing, so I decided to upgrade with this Olympus Camera and I have to say amazing pictures!!!! The only thing I’m not amazed by is that the flash pops up on the top of the camera and I feel like I might eventually brake it. but the zoom is incredibly amazing the pictures are great!!! I also took this camera to a concert and I was sitting so far away I needed Binoculars to see the performer so I brought out my camera and zoomed in and I was able to see the sweat on their faces, that’s how good this zoom is! also it has a nice "fast mode" opinion which was great for my vacation, when we were on tour buses passing by I was able to take several pictures which the bus was moving and get a couple of good shots unlike some people that took one shot and there would be a tree in the way by the time their camera set up again for a another shot the bus had moved to fast.

Reviews.Title: Great Shirt Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Rogsir
Reviews.Content: Love the 24X zoom and the variety of modes that can be used.Takes great pictures in the auto mode even in low light.The Users Manual is only available as a download, and the coverfor the connecter sockets is somewhat flimsy, but other than that,the camera surpasses my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera from Olympus
Reviews.Author: john  Imke
Reviews.Content: First off the one that I had previously purchased was a SZ-12  purchasing an additional card you can send your pictures by e-mail with out generating it from your computer. This has the same options except the lay out of the buttons are a little diffrent in where they are located, for instance the zoom is located on top next to the shutter button. The other thing I noticed was there is a little thumb pad situated on the right of the back to give your right hand some more support while holding the camrea great idea. And it's red so if you lay it down you can find it.

Reviews.Title: Just What I Wanted in a Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Roth "groth"
Reviews.Content: For the price on Amazon this camera is fantastic.  The options range from manual operation to the camera doing everything but push the shutter.  I have only had the SZ-12 for a couple weeks but have found it superior to other older digital camera I have had over the last decade or so that cost hundreds more.  With time in electronics we always see improvements with lower prices.  The camera is very intuitive to use which is a good thing because the instructions on the CD and in the box are not as concise as they should be.  I would suggest that the authors writing these instructions be from the culture that speaks/writes the language.  Of course, this is an issue with many imported products.For someone who wants a camera that will fit in a pocket or purse as well as offer great flexibility in all kinds of lighting situations, I think you would be happy with this camera.  I had read professional photographers' reviews that put the ability of this little guy in league with professional cameras.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12
Reviews.Author: James D. Brewer
Reviews.Content: The Olympus SZ-12 is easy to use and I love the 24 X optical zoom. I have shoot seascapes and landscapes, the picture quality is great. I've shot fire works with impressive results. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Im in love
Reviews.Author: Big Bill
Reviews.Content: First time using Olympus. Its working great. Great pics from a distance. And a great price. I bought one for my wife and I had to take my other camera back and get the same one she has. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Love this!
Reviews.Author: Dmariesweet
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!!!! The zoom on this thing is amazing!! I have pics of a lady bug that are so close and detailed you can see the pollen on her body! I took a pic of a butterfly and zoomed in so close you could see her tongue licking the flowers! So so awesome!!! I have this exact camera at my job as well to take pics for awards, retirements, etc.Only downside is the battery runs dead quick!

Reviews.Title: It's how you use it.
Reviews.Author: A. Tay "Private Tay"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a professional but I:a. avoid smartphone camerasb. try to get cameras with P A S M whenever I canSo was a bit worried since the SZ14 has no Aperture, Shutter and Manual controlWhy did I get it? For the 14x zoom for birds and squirrelsThe lens goes from 25mm to 600mm, f3 to 6.9Compared to the Lumix fz200 which is 24-600 f2.8 all the way, this is a bit disappointingBUT the Olympus is small enough to fit on a belt pouchAnd while there are now 24mm lenses with f1.8, the fastest 600mm is f4, so not badI spent days comparing the sz14 to the 16 and 31I know the 14 uses CCD sensor, while the others CMOSBut those cost about twice as much, for nowI chose this over the Lumix TZ30 because the button that slides between preview and shoot mode is a painI would have loved the Samsung Galaxy but it costs 3x as muchAnd to fully enjoy the Galaxy, I would need to get another SIM card (to SMS/MMS photos) and that would up my phone billThis is a bit of an extreme camera for me, in that I either use it at 25mm (because that's when the lens is 2.8)Or 600mm when I'm up against birds and squirrelsI know people will say it's not as sharp as an SLR etc etcBut if you think about it, if you can get decent shots with a compact such as this, then it should be easier with an SLRa. the sz14 has no viewfinder and when doing long shots, holding it at arm's length to look at the screen, it's easier to get camera shakeb. the power zoom is harder to use than the manual zoom on an SLR lens - because with power zoom, it ain't easy to get the exact focal length you want. And pesky birds have a way of flitting from one flower/branch to anotherThis is not a case of sour grapesI have the Canon 50x 'compact', Olympus m43 100-300 (which works out to 200-600mm) and various other stuffBut if you're not a professional, it's not easy to lug a camera with such zooming power every day, wherever you goColleagues and neighbours find it strange that I have to carry a pouch for the Lumix fz200 (24-600 f2.8)But the SZ14 can slip into a trouser back pocket - just make sure not to accidentally power up and wreck the zoom lensMost people class this as a travel cameraBut for me, when I travel, this won't be the only camera I bring(although it will be on my belt most of the time)Holidays for me are about pictures and I would take the Micro 43 cameras with 7.5mm fisheye, 9-18 (18-36), 14 (28) 2.5, 20 (40) 1.7 and 45 (90) 1.8The 75 (150) would be great but I can't afford itSo obviously I realize the limitations of the sz14But I would rather have a camera that can get a tight shot of a hummingbirdThan carry a camera that can get pin sharp shots - but all shot with a 40mm perspectiveYeah, it can be a pain scrolling through buttons to change ISO, EV etc etcThen again, for now, the most powerful zoom lenses are probably eitherCanon's 28-300 (full frame)or Nikon's 200-400 (full frame)Both costly and hugeOf course, if anyone could make a compact of this size with a 24-600mm f2.8 lens, Programmed, Aperture, Shutter and Manual and cost less than $1k, sure I would buy it26 Jan - the spot-metering is not as good as it should bea. there's no circle indicating the spot-meter area (unlike the Nikon p310)b. the spot meter doesn't seem very accurate, so pictures are not as dramatic as they could be

Reviews.Title: Flawed camera, BAD in action and low light shots
Reviews.Author: Brian G
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my wife in April of 2013. After 3 months the LCD screen went bonkers looking like pop art. I sent it back to Olympus who told me that it had a cracked LCD. The LCD did not show ANY signs of abuse..but was told that even a SLIGHT pressure on it could crack it internally. After much back and forth Olympus lowered their repair price (Yes they would not warranty it) from $109.00 to $69.00 Plus shipping of $10.00. I already had another $10.00 in shipping it to the. so i said go ahead and repair the 3 month old $149.00 camera. Now i had $247.00 in this camera. Fast forward to 1/25/2014 still less than a year from purchase....My wife drove from our house to Wal-Mart 30 miles away. It was a cold day but the car was warmed up soon after getting in it. She went inside the store and had to take audit pics (we are merchandisers). When she turned the camera on...LCD was messed up Again..Talked to Olympus..and if i were to choose another repair on the camera it would be another $95.00. This would mean I would have $352.00 in this $149.00 camera. I have had 2 fuji's and never had this problem. If you want a camera that breaks at the slightest nudge or temp change and don't care about throwing money at it then buy this camera and figure on re-furbishing it yourself every 3-6 months at more than the cost of a NEW one. A company's  warranty is as only as good as them standing by their product...Olympus had a real moneymaker in this camera for them with the "loopholes" to avoid repairs on their dime...I Will NEVER willingly buy Olympus products or recommend them to ANYONE...Stay Away.....

Reviews.Title: Beyond Expectations!
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Hayes
Reviews.Content: I'm no professional photographer, but I've had a digital camera before. Our last camera was a Kodak Easy-Share, and it was a reconditioned model. We wore it out. The photos were grainy, it had no zoom, and even outdoor pics in broad daylight left a lot to be desired.The Olympus SZ-12 is a huge improvement. The lens is large enough and wide enough to let in plenty of light, even for indoor shots with no flash. If daylight is coming in from windows, you will have great natural lighting. Be advised that the flash doesn't automatically come on in low light -- you have to flip it up manually. The focus is crystal clear. If the object of the shot is in motion, there will be some blur, but not much (like a dog wagging its tail), if the CAMERA moves during the shot, however, you will need to retake the shot.The zoom feature works beautifully. Pictures that used to show mountains barely there, far away on the horizon, now show up-close details of shrubbery, trees, and even grasses. We haven't tried the pan shot or video features yet, but we sure are pleased with what we've done so far.The time between pressing the button and the picture being taken is a fraction of a second, but the delay between taking the picture and being ready for the next shot is about 3 seconds. For us, that's not a huge deal, but for a devoted hobbyist photographer -- or a pro -- this would be a bad thing.The battery charged in less than 2 hours, and we got an 8 GB Sandisk memory card for it at Walmart. The more megapixels you use, the fewer shots you can take. The camera comes with a default setting at 14 MP, and we used up the onboard memory within 12 photos. When I reduced it to 3 MP, we suddenly had lots more room! With the camera set at 3 MP and the memory card in place, we can take over 9,000 pictures!!So, if you aren't a pro or devoted hobbyist and just want a really good camera for taking pics of the things you love, this is a great little work-horse. The vendor was terrific, though since we live in a remote location, delivery was delayed over a weekend. Our camera is new, not reconditioned, and we love it. We found it to be very intuitive to figure out how things work, and a quick reading of the manual (print or CD) will fill in the details.The features and capabilities of this little camera out-strip anything put out by any other digital camera maker, IMHO. After reading about Nikon, Canon, Kodak, Sony, and Panasonic, this one had the best of what we wanted for the price we could afford. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 14 MP Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Anncha Briggs
Reviews.Content: I have a feeling I will like it once I get used to all the different settings. The battery, however, is not as longlasting as I had hoped. My older Olympus was much better in that respect. I still use my old camera as abackup so it is a little too soon to give a fair product review.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ 12 digital camera
Reviews.Author: Real Guilbault
Reviews.Content: For the few times that I used the camera, I was quite pleased with. I still have to play with it to understand all the facets of this camera. With time and practice I will be able to upgrade or downgrade my comments.

Reviews.Title: Handy pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Anita Pratt
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the picture quality.  It over exposes a LOT of pictures.  Picture quality when zoomed in is poor even when it is on a tripod.  Well, I have had it for a couple of months now and I am liking it much better.  I learned how to correct the overexposure and a lot of other things about it.  It is a handy pocket camera.

Reviews.Title: amazon they don't do anything about this problem
Reviews.Author: TOP "TOP"
Reviews.Content: nothing for to say then laugh at it and cry at the same time i buy the olympus sz-12 SILVER cost me ( $ 117  ) but they send me the olympus sz-12 BLACK that only cost $ 97 and amazon they don't do anything about this problem

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Anthea R. Close
Reviews.Content: I sent this back as it was left at my door in an opened package. I saw the delivery person driving away and so he left the box like that. When I opened the box containing the camera there were finger marks all over the camera screen. I felt uncomfortable keeping the camera and so returned it. I informed what had happened. I am sure the camera is OK but  it arrived in a tampered with package. I did not buy another.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SZ-12 14MP
Reviews.Author: charles a lee
Reviews.Content: Great camera, strong zoom lens with an easy to follow menu......perfect for a beginner as well a camera buff. Camera was on sale but would be a great buy even if at full price.

Reviews.Title: battery malfunction
Reviews.Author: ike richmond
Reviews.Content: battery ran down with very little use. Camera was needed for granddaughter's graduation - battery ran down (empty) right at start of graduation.  Charger was not included with purchase

Reviews.Title: Broken
Reviews.Author: Charles L.
Reviews.Content: This item broke after about three months of use (lens will not retract back into the camera and will not take pictures).  Contacted the seller and was told to go to the manufacturer.  Not cool.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Akinlabi Hubbard
Reviews.Content: For a point-and-shoot, the SZ-12 really strives to give novice photographers an SLR experience.  The ISO can be tricky on auto, but after fooling around with it in a variety of different settings, I can feel which setting would be the most optimal.  The white balance is okay, it can be difficult to get the optimal amount of light into the photo without also getting noise, but that comes with the territory and compared to other cameras, SZ-12 does just wonderful.  I rarely, if ever use the pop-up flash.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Stephen V Kochjar Jr
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about cameras in general but I will say both my self and the receiving party love this camera. Once you enable the digital zoom this camera is great for getting that close shot from a long distance. I do strongly recommend using a tripod as it will steady your shot greatly. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: JCC
Reviews.Content: While this camera IS an Olympus, it is a CHEAP one at best. It may have 14MP & a 24x optical zoom, it takes only okay pics. The image stabilization MAY work but I can't tell you that it most certainly does. I have yet to take a long photo length pic & have it come out "in-focus", quite the opposite. Too bad. Yeah its cheap, but on all levels, so bear that in mind if you toss your $100.00 towards getting one. The menu options are 'just barely' enough to get you to some level of customization, but too many menu items don't let you change WHAT YOU WANT to change. For instance if you want to keep the camera on longer than the built-in timer, good-luck. You can use the default or you can leave it on 'till the battery runs down. Not too friendly.

Reviews.Title: A lot of camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: readsalot
Reviews.Content: So far,  a good camera for the money.  The price dropped again after I got mine and I bought one for my daughter.  I can't comment on lens quality as I have just taken a few snap shots.  The telephoto works good.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Katty
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it takes wonderful pictures and has many functions. The camera has a good size, but the pictures are great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: It is comfortable, lightweight and easy to use.  Can't wait to take my trip to Alaska and take pictures.  I definitely would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Murray Brown
Reviews.Content: The camera was just what I expected. I have always owned Olympus cameras since they are reliable and have all the properties I require.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for its price range
Reviews.Author: Mischaia88
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the cheapest superzoom with capability of recording video with zoom and sound. My researches brought me to Olympus SZ-12 which I've purchased. I am totally satisfied with it. The camera is fairly compact for the lens it packs. It's made of plastic while front plate is metal. Grip is very decent, so is controllability. There are two awkward things about this little camera, first of which is mode dial. It has usual 4-way control coped with ability to rotate. It's a little confusing, perhaps needs some getting used to. Second thing is battery charging. You have to charge it via USB cable + charger, inside the camera. It's not what I like, but it is bearable.Of course SZ-12 suffers from all the drawbacks of small sensor (lower image quality than larger format cameras, bad high ISO performance) and superzoom lens (image distortion, chromatic aberrations), but these are flaws that all cameras of this kind have so I give Olympus SZ-12 5-star rating and recommend it highly to anybody who wishes to have decent superzoom for low price.

Reviews.Title: Great walk around camera
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Laux
Reviews.Content: Light, easy to handle, powerful zoom,  easy to use functions.Fun 'Photoshop' features if wanted.Only complaint:  no black and white.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Rex Allen
Reviews.Content: nice little camera...takes great pictures.....the zoom really doesn't bring things that close...it says it is a 24 but i would guess it to be more like a 10.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Mary-O
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good little camera. Takes nice sharp pictures. It's really quick so I can use it to take photos of my kids and animals.
